author: potuz
content: Any chance the public v1 testnet will be up before the deposit cuttof? I feel very uneasy depositing without having tested the actual software that I'll be using in the same spec conditions as mainnet

author: protolambda
content:
We've a devnet for v1 that's doing really well, here: https://toledo.beaconcha.in/
We plan to do another public net for v1, but need to work out some details before fully comitting to that.

author: potuz
content: Yes I've been following toledo, but still will want to run my own node in it, in particular, the prysm nodes that are being run in that testnet are many PRs behind of those that will be run on mainnet.

author: potuz
content: I'd like to test in my own hardware before depositing

author: potuz
content: it's not unreasonable, I suppose there are others like me

author: protolambda
content: Yep, understand. You can be on the bleeding edge now and run a beacon node without validators on Toledo. Or you wait until we finalize the details for next testnet, which may go live as early as start next week

author: protolambda
content: Prysm has a toledo docker image, and toledo command flag, for running with the settings you need. More toledo details can be found here: https://github.com/protolambda/toledo

author: potuz
content: Well, the most scary PRs deal with the validator protection db for example... while the beacon is a good test of resources, I'd feel much better if I test that I am not slashed, and for this I'll need to test the validator

author: potuz
content: I don't mind waiting, and I don't need to be in genesis, but will be a pitty after all the time invested to miss this just because I wasn't able to test the software before

author: protolambda
content: Yes, good point. Will ping the prysm team for an update on that.

author: potuz
content: Oh they are already up to it, I can build their branch

author: potuz
content: all we need is the testnet's genesis

author: potuz
content: But thank you for taking this into account. Raul from prysm told me he'll talk about this tomorrow in the call

author: protolambda
content: We plan to discuss the next testnet on the Eth2 implementers call tomorrow yes. It does not make any sense to rush and put up details for the testnet before the devs have had a chance to give feedback about Toledo, and future testnet (dubbed "Pyrmont")

author: potuz
content: Sounds good to me.

author: potuz
content: I just hope the genesis time of Pyrmont is at least a few hours before the cuttof on Nov 24th

author: protolambda
content: We did prepare a deposit contract on goerli with 100.000 validators though, and exact settings like mainnet. If we are ready for a testnet, we won't have to wait for deposits more than we like

author: protolambda
content: And toledo is running pretty well too. Alternatively we just open up that testnet. Will discuss all options on call tomorrow

author: potuz
content: Thank you
